snippet: In a rare step, doctors revising psychiatry’s diagnostic manual have retreated from two controversial proposals that would have expanded the number of people identified as having psychotic or depressive disorders.
abstract: Doctors on a panel appointed by the American Psychiatric Assn revising the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, in a rare step, retreat from two controversial proposals that would have expanded the number of people identified as having psychotic or depressive disorders.
lead_paragraph: In a rare step, doctors revising psychiatry’s diagnostic manual have retreated from two controversial proposals that would have expanded the number of people identified as having psychotic or depressive disorders.

headline.seo: D.S.M. Panel Backs Down on Diagnoses
headline.main: Psychiatry Manual Drafters Back Down on Diagnoses
headline.print_headline: Psychiatry Manual Drafters Back Down on Diagnoses
